title: Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators
description: British technology minister Liz Kendall said on Tuesday the government was seeking a "reset" on plans to overhaul copyright rules to accommodate artificial intelligence, pledging to protect creators while unlocking AI's economic potential.

title: 'Innovation From Anywhere': Pentagon Wants Elon Musk's Grok AI In The War Room
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced that Pentagon will integrate Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot Grok into Google’s generative AI engine for operating inside the network. He added that the integration is part of a broader push to update developing technology with as much military data as possible.
content:
US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced that the Pentagon will integrate Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot Grok AI in its operational network, alongside Google’s generative AI engine.

description: Gaming News: Warhammer maker Games Workshop has reportedly banned its workers from using artificial intelligence (AI) to design tabletop miniatures from the game. .

title: Malaysia will take legal action against X over misuse of Grok
description: Malaysian authorities said Tuesday they will take legal action against Elon Musk’s social media platform X and its artificial intelligence unit xAI, accusing the companies of failing to ensure the safety of users of its Grok chatbot.

title: ‘Artificial’ Intelligence Needs ‘Actual’ Energy, Says Masdar Chairman
description: In the age of AI, the world needs molecules to make electrons and pragmatic solutions, Masdar chairman Dr. Sultan Al Jaber tells Abu Dhabi Sustainability Week.

title: SK Hynix to invest nearly $13B in chip packaging plant in South Korea
description: SEOUL — South Korean chip giant SK hynix said on Tuesday it would spend 19 trillion won ($12.9 billion) building an advanced chip packaging plant as the firm rides a global artificial intelligence (AI) boom.

title: How the next AI boom may be powered from space
description: Artificial intelligence needs vast amounts of power. Earth's electricity systems may not be enough for AI's rapid growth. Experts suggest looking to space for solutions. Space-based solar power could provide constant, clean energy. This technology is being studied by space agencies. It could unlock new AI advancements without straining resources.
